page.title: 01Gazetteer
page.content: The River Severn flows through the area from north to south in a curve that takes it past the villages of Jackfield and Coalport,which are rich in the relics of the clay industries of the 19th.Century.The Coalport China Works and the Craven Dunhill Tile Works are open to the public and form part of the Ironbridge Gorge Museum . The banks of the river are heavily wooded while away from the river the land is mainly arable and mixed farming. At the western edge of the area are the outskirts of the town of Broseley where new housing estates have been and are being built over land previously used for the old tile works and clay industries.A primary school built in 1976 serves these areas.
